file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-31-00-03 - BAGGAGE-DOOR ACTUATING AND LOCKING MECHANISM - SERVICING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BAGGAGE-DOOR ACTUATING AND LOCKING MECHANISM - SERVICING EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to lubricate the baggage door gear box. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 52-31-00-600-801-A ♦ BAGGAGE DOOR - LUBRICATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-31-00 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-31-00-600-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BAGGAGE DOOR - LUBRICATION A. General (1) The baggage door is on the left side of the fuselage aft section. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-51-02-000-801-A/400 BAGGAGE DOOR LINING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-51-02-400-801-A/400 BAGGAGE DOOR LINING - INSTALLATION S.B.145-52-0012 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 813 Passenger cabin - LH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Brush To lubricate the baggage door AR available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-G-23827B, TYPE I Grease AR Tiolon A20 Teflon AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the baggage door I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the lining of the baggage door ( AMM TASK 25-51-02-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 600-801-A/300 52-31-00 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Remove the screws and washers (29 positions for POST-MOD. S.B.145-52-0012 and 4 positions for PRE-MOD. S.B. 145-52-0012) to remove the cover to get access to the compensating mechanism. J. Lubricate Baggage Door Gear Box (Figure 301) (Figure 302) SUBTASK 640-002-A (1) Lubricate the track races fully. (2) Lubricate the actuating handle. (3) Lubricate the lifting and lowering mechanism. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A WARNING: DO NOT APPLY LUBRICANTS OR EQUIVALENT PRODUCTS TO THE INTERFACE OF THE DOOR WITH THE FUSELAGE. (1) Install the lining of the baggage door ( AMM TASK 25-51-02-400-801-A/400). (2) Install the screws and washers (29 positions for POST-MOD. S.B.145-52-0012 and 4 positions for PRE-MOD. S.B. 145-52-0012) to install the cover of the compensating mechanism ( AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 600-801-A/300 52-31-00 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
